name: wol
description: wol is a small self-hosted tool for sending Wake-on-LAN packets to machines on your network. It provides a simple interface to store hosts and wake them remotely, making remote power management easier for homelab setups.
features: Host storage: Save device MAC addresses and friendly names for repeated wake operations.
Magic packet sending: Transmit Wake-on-LAN packets to power on compatible network devices remotely.
Simple interface: Minimal UI focused on quick device wake without unnecessary complexity.
Network discovery: Scan local network to detect devices and their MAC addresses automatically.
Batch operations: Wake multiple devices simultaneously with a single action.
Command-line support: Use CLI commands for scripting and automation alongside the web interface.
Port configuration: Customize WOL packet destination ports for non-standard network setups.
Lightweight deployment: Minimal resource footprint suitable for running on low-power devices.
Cross-platform: Works on Linux, Windows, and macOS for flexible deployment options.
JSON configuration: Store device configurations in simple JSON files for easy backup and migration.
No database required: File-based storage eliminates the need for database setup and maintenance.
Docker ready: Deploy quickly with pre-built Docker images and simple configuration.
